title: 'We are not used to doing these things' - Guardiola praises landmark Man City win
description: Pep Guardiola says Manchester City are "not used to doing these things" after they win at Real Madrid for the first time to take control of their Champions League last-16 tie.

title: Maria Sharapova goes quietly into retirement - but it will not be the last we hear of her
description: Maria Sharapova may be going quietly into retirement but it certainly will not be the last we hear of her, writes Russell Fuller.

title: Bernie Sanders: 17 things the Democratic front-runner believes
description: The Democratic candidate has promised a political revolution. But what actually are his stances?

title: 'This is no fluke; we were faultless' - Gerrard revels in Rangers win
description: Rangers' Europa League win over Braga was "no fluke" and was an "outstanding" display, says manager Steven Gerrard.

title: How to self-isolate
description: Five ways to successfully self-isolate to prevent the spread of the virus.

title: Five countries, five responses
description: How countries are battling the virus - from disinfectant lorries in China to roadblocks in Italy.

title: Your rights as a traveller
description: The coronavirus has already become a nightmare for travellers and the tourism industry alike.

title: Why are some schools closing over coronavirus?
description: The official advice is that schools should not close, so why are some shutting their doors?

title: 'We might be stuck in here for weeks'
description: Hannah Green and her family are in the hotel in Tenerife that's been quarantined by Covid-19 fears.

title: Will I get paid if I self-isolate?
description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock says Britons returning from locked-down Italian towns must self-isolate.

title: Nurse's request for premature baby sleeves is viral hit
description: Knitters from all over the world are helping premature babies be more comfortable in hospital.

title: Coronavirus: Hundreds of flu patients to be tested by UK hospitals and GPs
description: Tests are planned at 100 selected GP surgeries and eight hospitals to monitor the spread of the virus.

title: 'Just call me Harry' prince tells tourism conference in Edinburgh
description: The Queen's grandson speaks at an event in Edinburgh weeks ahead of stepping down from royal duties

title: Bewdley flooding: Residents evacuated as flood defences breached
description: Flood warnings remain in place along the River Severn as defences were overtopped in Worcestershire.

title: Greggs paper bag lands student in court on littering charge, 11 years later
description: Grace Firth was fined £40 after pleading guilty to a littering offence which happened in March 2009.

title: Why Bob Iger's long goodbye to Disney is a very big deal
description: The news that the Disney boss is stepping down as CEO has taken the movie world by surprise.

title: Coronavirus: Global shares fall for fifth day in a row
description: Stock markets have faced days of turmoil as concern about coronavirus mounts.

title: Facebook dramas 'consuming Merthyr Tydfil council's energy'
description: Political "dramas" played out online are taking resources away from "more important matters".

title: Sport Relief: Nick Grimshaw back after break due to heat exhaustion
description: The Radio 1 Presenter says his body temperature went up to around forty degrees.

title: Coronavirus: Outbreak spreads in Europe from Italy
description: Cases have emerged in several countries involving travellers from Italy, but borders remain open.

title: Kyrgios accuses fans of 'disrespect' after retirement in Mexico
description: Nick Kyrgios accuses the Mexican Open crowd of "disrespect" after he is booed off court following his first-round retirement against Ugo Humbert.

title: Coronavirus: Six Nations games under threat and five Serie A matches to be played behind closed doors
description: Ireland's Six Nations game against Italy in Dublin on March 7 should be postponed due to the coronavirus situation, says Irish Health Minister Simon Harris.

title: Becoming a detective 'in a matter of months'
description: We meet two of the first ever recruits on a new police scheme aimed at tackling the national shortfall.

title: Singer Duffy 'drugged, raped and held captive'
description: The Grammy and Brit award-winning singer has written on Instagram that her "recovery took time".

title: Women's T20 World Cup highlights: Heather Knight hits century as England crush Thailand
description: Heather Knight's maiden T20 international century helps England overcome an early wobble to seal a comfortable 98-run win over Thailand at the Women's T20 World Cup.

title: LeBron James scores season-high 40 points for Lakers
description: LeBron James scores a season-high 40 points as the Los Angeles Lakers beat the visiting New Orleans Pelicans 118-109 on Tuesday.

title: Knight hits century as England beat Thailand
description: Captain Heather Knight hits her first Twenty20 international century as England crush Thailand by 98 runs at the Women's T20 World Cup.

title: Virgin Galactic sees demand for space travel surge
description: Sir Richard Branson's firm says it is releasing more tickets for flights into space.

title: The Papers: Coronavirus 'action plan' and 'mass testing' in UK
description: Wednesday's papers say UK schools face closure in new plans to stop the spread of the virus.

title: Solari boards: The disappearing sound of airports
description: Inside airports, old-school departure boards are falling silent. Outside, it's a different story.

title: Sydney baboons go on the run before vasectomy
description: Three baboons - one on his way to a vasectomy - fled an Australian hospital, stunning onlookers.

title: Dealing with emotions: Borderline personality disorder
description: Borderline personality disorder, also known as BPD, is characterised by strong emotional reactions, a distorted sense of self and difficult personal relationships.

title: Underwater Photographer of the Year
description: The winners of the Underwater Photographer of the Year competition 2020.

title: Secret doorway in Parliament leads to historical treasure trove
description: Historical treasures - and evidence of a beer-fuelled party - are uncovered in the Commons restoration.

title: Sickest NHS patients 'face hours on trolleys'
description: BBC analysis shows a surge in hospital delays as experts warn 'little in tank' to cope with coronavirus.

title: 'How do I convince the Home Office I'm a lesbian?'
description: More than 1,500 people claim asylum in the UK each year, claiming that they are persecuted for being gay. But it's not an easy thing to prove.

title: Could North Korea handle a Covid-19 outbreak?
description: So far, the country claims to have no cases of Covid-19 - but that has been questioned.

description: How do you build a market for a product society considers unmentionable?

title: Dorset woman celebrates three decades of sphynx cats
description: Jan Plumb brought a hairless sphynx cat to the UK in 1988, when the breed was extremely rare.

title: How a serious accident led to business success
description: After a terrible skiing crash, Susanne Najafi embarked on her path as a serial entrepreneur.
